course.subject: CORE
course.name: Accounting, Business & Society
course.description: Overview of accounting in business and social contexts; use of accounting information for accountability and decision-making in companies, non-profit organizations, and government; major elements of accounting, including assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses; discharge of accountability by companies through corporate social and environmental reports. The aim of this course is to make students aware of how accounting could be applicable to fundamental business transactions and ways to evaluate how businesses are operated.
course.prerequisites: a passing letter grade in CORE 1401 OR CORE 1402 OR CORE 1403 OR CORE 1404 OR LANG 1002 (prior to 2022-23)

reviews.author: lmhayden
reviews.title: Good common core
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 - Business and The Accounting Profession
Week 2 - Ethics/Corporate Governance/CSR Framework
Week 3 - Foundation Concepts of Accounting
Week 4 - Measuring Income to Assess Performance
Week 5 - Accrual Accounting and Financial Statements
Week 6 - Statement of Cash Flow
Week 7 - Accounting for Sales
Week 8 - Inventories and Cost of Goods Sold
============== Midterm ==============
Week 9 - Long-lived Assets and Depreciation
Week 10 - Liabilities and Interest
Week 11 - Stockholder’s Equity
Week 12, 13 - Financial Statement Analysis

The content is not too difficult for a non-business student (such as me) although I did not studied any business subject (such as BAFS) in secondary school.
reviews.comment_teaching: Steven is very good at teaching and explaining some difficult concept to us. He took into account the fact that we are not business students, so some difficult contents are cut. I like this attitude. This shows me that he wants us to learn something from him instead of just wanting to earn his salary.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is good.

Participation (10%), Individual assignment (10%), Mid-term Examination (40%), Final Examination (40%).

Midterm exam only cover questions about corporate governance (week 2), ethics (week 2), bank reconciliation and update cash book (week 7); and inventory and cost of goods sold (week 8).

Final exam only cover questions about Long-lived Assets and Depreciation (week 9), Liabilities and Interest (week 10), Stockholder’s Equity (week 11) and Financial Statement Analysis (week 12, 13)

(Final exam is more slightly difficult than midterm exam.)

my mark:
Participation: 10/10
Individual assignment: 100/100
Mid-term Examination: 99/100
Final Examination: unrelease

Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is nearly none. You only need to summit one assignment.
